The stay was more than a stay, it was an experience.

This spot is magical! The cabin may be small, but I can't think of a thing that would improve it. My husband and I enjoyed a short getaway, but I could also imagine coming here for a solo retreat or even a cozy stay with the kids. (Though they're about to list a new, larger cabin on the same property, so we'd probably stay there if they came.) The weather in mid-November was unseasonably warm, so we got to play games on the screened porch and read on the front porch that overlooks the horse pasture. We took long walks around the property and saw deer and an owl. Even Lars' and Cay's dogs were hospitable, welcoming us as soon as we pulled up and accompanying us on our walks.
You could certainly stay on the property your whole visit without getting bored. There's tennis, basketball, horseback riding, and even a lovely pool in season. But we took a drive to Cleveland one night and ate dinner on the patio at Hey Joe's (which felt safe because of the open air, even during Covid) and then took a long stroll through the impressive downtown Christmas light display. The next day, we drove over to Greenville for a catfish sandwich at Gino's (thanks to the recommendation of a previous reviewer!), a peaceful walk through the Greenville Cypress Preserve, a drive to Warfield Point Park to see the Mississippi River, and finally a stop by Winterville Mounds to see some of the largest remaining mounds constructed by indigenous people a thousand years ago.
All in all, it was a fantastic getaway and I'm trying to figure out how soon I can get back!
